statement: Satyam is given n distinct points on the 2D coordinate plane. It is guaranteed that 0 ≤q y_i ≤q 1 for all given points (x_i, y_i). How many different nondegenerate right triangles^{\text{∗}} can be formed from choosing three different points as its vertices?Two triangles a and b are different if there is a point v such that v is a vertex of a but not a vertex of b.^{\text{∗}}A nondegenerate right triangle has positive area and an interior 90^{\circ} angle.
input_specification: InputThe first line contains an integer t (1 ≤q t ≤q 10^4) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains an integer n (3 ≤q n ≤q 2 · 10^5) — the number of points.The following n lines contain two integers x_i and y_i (0 ≤q x_i ≤q n, 0 ≤q y_i ≤q 1) — the i'th point that Satyam can choose from. It is guaranteed that all (x_i, y_i) are pairwise distinct.It is guaranteed that the sum of n over all test cases does not exceed 2 · 10^5.
output_specification: OutputOutput an integer for each test case, the number of distinct nondegenerate right triangles that can be formed from choosing three points.
